result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erin Rachel Bearheart

defendant.name: Bearheart, Erin Rachel
defendant.address: 3220 Billy Boy Lane, Shell Lake, WI 54871

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Erin Rachel Bearheart
Current: 3220 Billy Boy Lane, Shell Lake, WI 54871 United States  (Effective: 11-23-2015)
Prior: 24933 Eaglefeather Dr, Webster, WI 54893
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
NO USE OR POSSESSION OF CONTROLLED OR ILLEGAL DRUGS OR SUBSTANCES UNLESS PRESCRIBED BY A PHYSICIAN.

No use or possession of controlled or illegal drugs or substances unless prescribed by a physician. Defendant may be released from custody in lieu of cash to go directly into a treatment Center approved by the Department, provided she completes the program successfully and reports directly back to jail once completed. If treatment successfully completed the bond to then be converted to a signature bond.

Erin Bearheart in Court (in custody).  DA Wm. Norine in Court.  Court advises Erin she has right to have attorney for bail hearing in criminal cases, she wishes to proceed alone for bail hearing.  Court asks Erin why she didn't show up for Court on July 6th.  She wasn't around and wasn't aware she had court on July 6th.  She appeared on June 22nd and she was given notice of the next hearing.  Erin uses Eagle Feather Drive as her address but wasn't allowed to stay there.  She is currently under a $2500 signature bond.  DA is not comfortable with straight signature bond due to the case type and lack of appearances.  This is not the first time she has failed to appear, there is a bail jump in 15 CF 71.  Court orders:  under $2500 signature bond, converted to $2500 cash.  Key to get out is:  allow her to be released from custody without any cash whatsoever so long as it is going into a treatment center approved by the Dept., Fahrman, Keystone, Hazelden, anywhere else, provided that she completes it succussfully and reports back to the jail once it is completed.  If she successfully completes it, it would go back to straight signature bond.  Amended bond to be prepared by Clerk.  Nothing further.  Case adjourned.
